file_content.text: Today: The World Razer fears the Burning Way.
Today: Only the Burning Way remains to stop the World Razer. And only Failsafe remembers the Burning Way.
There aren't many who would condemn themselves to a lifetime of captivity.
You're very selfless.
An eternity of imprisonment is a heavy sentence, particularly for one who didn't deserve it.
That's hardly fair for you.
You've committed no crime. You should be free, not stuck in some tube.
You don't belong here.
Couldn't you have just left a note or something?
Seems a little unnecessary.
Tomorrow: More horrors dwell in the vaults, waiting to escape. The prison needs its Failsafe.
The Esh-kha must not have wanted you telling anyone how to stop them.
That's why you were attacked.
Today: Gore Claw fears Failsafe's words.
The Burning Way... what is that?
Burning Way?
Tomorrow: The Burning Way opens. The World Razer screams, buried under fire and rock.
Yesterday: The World Razer is bested. The Builders seal it beneath the planet's crust and construct the Burning Way to safeguard its imprisonment.
Today: The Esh-kha race to revive the World Razer and destroy the Burning Way. The World Razer's time draws near.
Then I need to get down there and stop them.
I'd better hurry.
How did the Esh-kha find out about the Burning Way?
How do they know about it?
Yesterday: The Builders' whips crack against the Esh-kha's backs. The Esh-kha labor to complete the way. They do not forget.
If your people had just destroyed the World Razer, we wouldn't be in this mess.
You should have killed it.
Yesterday: The World Razer's power is timeless. The Builders can subdue it, shackle it, but never destroy it.
Today: The World Razer waits in the depths. The Esh-kha amass under Gore Claw's banner, preparing for their final triumph.
Today: Preserve the Burning Way, and seal the World Razer's fate.
Tomorrow: A thousand planets burn. A hundred stars wither and collapse. The World Razer consumes all.
Yesterday: Failsafe sees too much--says too much. He tells of certain pasts and uncertain futures. His people must seal him away.
Today: Esh-kha pound on the glass. They want to kill Failsafe. But someone intervenes. Failsafe is grateful.
Today: Esh-kha pound on the glass. They want to kill Failsafe. But strangers intervene. Failsafe is grateful.
All this time I thought I was looking for a device, not a person.
This is a surprise.
Today: Failsafe is forgotten. His people are no more. Only his enemies remember him.
My pleasure.
What are you saying?
Yesterday: Failsafe's words confuse many. He sees and feels all at once. Few understand.
Today: Many seek out the World Razer. Already its eye begins to open. Soon it will awaken.
Tomorrow: A moon of metal screams fire. The galaxy shudders and a planet dies.
